quote: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: I never did a day's work in my life. It was all fun.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: Anything that won't sell, I don't want to invent. Its sale is proof of utility, and utility is success.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: To invent, you need a good imagination and a pile of junk.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: We often miss opportunity because it's dressed in overalls and looks like work.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: The three great essentials to achieve anything worth while are: Hard work, Stick-to-itiveness, and Common sense.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: What you are will show in what you do.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: The value of an idea lies in the using of it.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: Restlessness is discontent—and discontent is the first necessity of progress.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: I start where the last man left off.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: There’s a way to do it better—find it.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: Many inventions fail because the inventor has not asked himself how it can be useful.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: The best thinking has been done in solitude.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: Never go into business just for money.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: The doctor of the future will give no medicine but will interest his patients in the care of the human frame, in diet and in the cause and prevention of disease.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: I find out what the world needs. Then I proceed to invent.
author: Thomas Edison
